posts.post_content: The pinnacle of "Timmydom". Big creature, scary creature, fast, hard to kill, and its a DRAGON. Timmies can't ask for much more than this.. I mean seriously. In the MTG universe, this thing is a "Hellkite Overlord", so some kind of leader or alpha-creature among the "Hellkites", the bigger and more powerful dragons of MTG. So how does this thing stack up to the other reanimation creatures? In terms of cost, I consider it better than [Akroma, Angel of Fury](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Fury), certainly, but the Angel of Wrath? Hard pick. The angel is immune to most removal spells but the hellkite hits harder. I'm not sure.
posts.html:
The pinnacle of "Timmydom". Big creature, scary creature, fast, hard to kill, and its a DRAGON. Timmies can't ask for much more than this.. I mean seriously. In the MTG universe, this thing is a "Hellkite Overlord", so some kind of leader or alpha-creature among the "Hellkites", the bigger and more powerful dragons of MTG. So how does this thing stack up to the other reanimation creatures? In terms of cost, I consider it better than Akroma, Angel of Fury, certainly, but the Angel of Wrath? Hard pick. The angel is immune to most removal spells but the hellkite hits harder. I'm not sure.

posts.post_content: Despite cheap white removal like [Path to Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path to Exile), Hellkite Overlord is definitely the best dragon in standard, capable of destroying the opponent without much resistence. Not to mention with mana acceleration like [Rampant Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rampant Growth), [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise ) and [Garruk Wildspeaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk Wildspeaker ) this guy can be in play as early as turn four or five. With insane abalities and amazing artwork and flavor text its difficult to imagine anyone who deosn't like this card.
posts.html:
Despite cheap white removal like Path to Exile, Hellkite Overlord is definitely the best dragon in standard, capable of destroying the opponent without much resistence. Not to mention with mana acceleration like Rampant Growth, Birds of Paradise and Garruk Wildspeaker this guy can be in play as early as turn four or five. With insane abalities and amazing artwork and flavor text its difficult to imagine anyone who deosn't like this card.

posts.post_content: This card effectiveness has dropped with new cards like resounding silence and path the exile that dont destory cards. Its still a nice card and is safe from most removal. The haste and trample can make a win out of no where. But there are other much cheaper finishers that are even harder to kill. Still is a great card and im glad to have it in my deck.
